intro: Munronia palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan munronia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines, specifically found on the island of Palawan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often in lowland forests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
